item.title: Report E-2024010353
item.description:
Report E-2024010353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of DOWSIL™ Z-6689 (UN1993) Water Repellent was released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3173109. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 65-gallon DM containing DOWSIL™ Z-6689 Water Repellent was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010229
item.description:
Report E-2024010229

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GrayMar Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft- by-2ft area of the concrete trailer yard and a 10ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released due to a nail puncture from a pallet during offloading that damaged one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. GrayMar Environmental Services personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and recovered the spent material and containerized into one (1) 55- gallon metal drum. The damaged metal drum was over-packed into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was stage onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Service provider returned the empty jerrican to the station to report on the damage of the package. DescribePack: One puncture at the bottom corner of the jerrican. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cleanup at delivery location.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery it appears that the storage tank over-pressurized and allowed approximately 5 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. The customer made arrangements for the clean-up.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found crushed inside the trailer and was immediately removed from the delivery process DescribePack: the package contained two bottle of ZEP Industrial Purple degreaser. It was found crushed inside the trailer and the bottles completely open and almost empty DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the delivery process and was placed in a container before processing it.

item.title: Report X-2024010202
item.description:
Report X-2024010202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded incorrectly by either the driver or shipper. Package was loaded onto its side and not with arrows upwards, causing the loose cap to allow a leakage. Once discovered while unloading, the ruck was evacuated and absorbent mats were used to clean spill. A lined hazardous material red tote was used to transport the damage hazmat to the hazardous processing area. DescribePack: The root of the package's failure was the loose cap on one of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A quick clean up was done to mitigate the effects of the release. The area was cleared, and PPE was used in order to clean the spill properly and efficiently.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The container was found in the unload. The container was immediately placed in an upright position to minimize spill. It was then placed in a red hazmat container with absorbent pads underneath. Spill was cleaned with absorbent pads. Hazmat spilled for less than a minute. And taken to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: the size of the puncture was the size of a pea. And leaked from the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The container was put in a hazmat bucket to avoid more spillage. Absorbent pads were used to keep from leaking. And absorbent used to clean spill.

  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon spill of regulated UN1090 "Klean-Strip Acetone" that was released at Terminal LAB. (1) a five-gallon metal pail was punctured by other freight during dock operations impacting Dock #21. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE.(1) 10-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged metal pail, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

AT THIS TIME PPE WAS USED TO PUT THE HAZMAT INSIDE OF THE YELLOW DRUM FOR SAFETY. DescribePack: DIDN'T SEE THE FAILURE HOWEVER IT WAS DROPPED AND ALL THE LIQUID IS EXPELLED FROME GLASS CONTAINER DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED INSIDE THE BLUE BAG AND PUT INTO THE YELLOW DRUM AND PLACE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report E-2024010345
item.description:
Report E-2024010345

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-20T00:33:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of One Ethanol Racing Fuel E85+117 (UN3475) were released from (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that they were okay to clean it with PPE at location. The debris and PPE were placed into a 20-gallon DM and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
